posts.author: Empty
posts.content:
Back for another Blackguard build.

This one is a lot more basic than the last one. I think, at least. It's a Spellsword Bg build for Arelith, and I've never made a Bard focused build before, so I could use some help getting started. I was thinking something like, 15 Bard, 10 Fighter, 5 Bg. I'm open to changes and suggestions, as well as letting me know what spells I should take that would be best for my class.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Bard 20/ Fighter 6/ Blackguard 4 with (12/ 4/ 4) split pre-epic. Take Blackguard 3rd level at 12th and 4th level at 15th, in order to take the Divine feats. Take last Bard level at 30th level and take the " Lasting Inspiration " feat.

Starting Attributes: (STR 16  DEX 08  CON 14  INT 12  WIS 08  CHA 16) - Human

Feats: Power Attack, Cleave, Weapon Focus, Weapon Specialization, Improved Critical, Blind Fight, Divine Shield, Divine Might, Knockdown, Still Spell, Curse Song

Epic Feats: Epic Weapon Focus, Epic Weapon Specialization, Epic Prowess, Lasting Inspiration, Great Strength I

Ending Attributes: (STR 24  DEX 08  CON 14  INT 12  WIS 08  CHA 16)

posts.author: Empty
posts.content: Won't I be missing some BAB, since Arelith forces 3 consecutive levels for the first three levels of the class? I.E Bard 8 / Fighter 1 being impossible unless I take 3 Fighter levels together due to server rulings.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: 3/4 BAB classes work in clusters of " Four ", as long as you have 12 Bard levels pre-epic, no matter where you get them, your base BAB will always be 17. Arelith's 30 level limit makes that 22 final BAB.
